intro: Hillia matudae, commonly known as the Matudas hillia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils in high-altitude regions. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
